I love the kit riot, but why remove one of the biggest aspects of his character, that makes swain a memorable character, and replace beatrice, the crows, and his entire style for a stupid edgelord demon look? It completely kills the uniqueness of his character and makes him look like the darkin and Vlad. Im completely dissappointed with this update as it just makes him look as bland and boring as the rest of the edgy demon champions in the roster.

Honestly speaking; while this new character doesn't look bad, it also doesn't feel at all like Swain.

All the key elements that made him have his unique flavour (his walking animation and cane, his bird, his transformation) have been removed in favour of dark magic that is generic and disappointing. I didn't even consider removing these things would be an option when they're literally the most iconic thing about the character.

I thought we were past the point where reworks completely changed the core essence of characters. Why have we gone backwards on Swain and given so little care to respecting the established unique identity he held??

No opinions on the kit, but I _really_ don't like the new look. He just doesn't read as Swain anymore to me. Where's Beatrice? Where's his limp? Both of those were majorly significant to the character.

Not really fond of the white hair, either. If you're going to give him a luscious flowing mane of hair, go for a dark color. Especially with his raven connections.

If you guys are really married to this new look, please, please, please do a Traditional skin.
How could u take Beatrice from us riot ;_;

So, I feel torn. I understand one of the cohesive goals here was to make him look more properly Noxian. I wasn't supremely attached to his old look (I mainly used Tyrant with bits of classic/Northern Front/2% or so of Bilgewater), so I'm not going to mislead there.

Beatrice not being on his shoulder in some form _irritates_ me to no end, however. I know there's passive crow usage and the nod with the ultimate. But it was an important character relationship to me. I assume it was not included because she could be visually misleading in some way or make him too busy. But I also don't see why she couldn't have some kind of perch on his old jacket. 

I've been trying to eyeball his jacket/Swain himself in-game to see if it's really create a clash to re-imagine his old perch. I don't think it would sans with his ultimate and that's still an IF. It really hurts his character to have the raven-theme diminished for a more generic overlord/warlock look.

Which ties into the ultimate---and is more of a secondary complaint. It felt like this was no reason not to keep the full transformation look as well. I don't know if it's because there was deadlines with modeling or what. But it was one of the fun parts of transforming and felt like you really embraced the transformation. I'm not really fond of the "just the wings" aspect with the graphical pop-in. Graphical pop-in looks great---I don't want to pay it disrespect, but it's brief. The movement animation looks a bit awkward (kind of reminds me of Kayle/Aatrox ult).  It's still readable though for an in-game perspective, so it works.

Though I really liked his present kit (I was very happy with the Q rework; I like him as a dot mage), I'm going to try to be optimistic here:

The kit on the other hand barring numbers looks promising without him being as oppressive (though now it's a lot of skillshots of varying length and delay). With the increased vision/CC, I understand wanting to gate him. I'll have to see it in actual practice. I imagine rylai/glacial augment might play well with him. Especially since I presume he'll still be wanting hourglass.
Agreed. The kit seems ok but they gave his look the Yorick/Galio treatment, which is a complete failure to me.

Is Beatrice at least still part of his lore, now that you cut her from his kit? Also, why was that choice made, and why was his profile changed to be something entirely different? Swain was crippled, he needed a cane to walk, or at least that's what he made people think. Who knows what the truth really was. That was part of what made him an interesting character, he'd succeeded in a nation where strength is -everything-, despite his physical disadvantages. Removing those removes what made Swain, Swain. I mean, I like that he's still the leader, and that you at least still make allusions to him being a great strategist, but his appearance is just entirely different. 
In all honesty, if I didn't know who he was, I'd have said he was a reworked Vladimir. 

I've no idea who worked on the update, but can we get some context? Please? I'm trying to keep things constructive, but it's a bit difficult when we have nothing to weigh these massives changes again.

I'm sorry - I'm not on the Swain team (I don't work directly on League at all) and I feel stupid for turning up in a Swain thread when I can't speak to these questions. :(  

I responded to Blood Magicks because they specifically had wondered if Swain was going to have long hair, and I knew, from seeing the splash art internally, that he would have long hair.  Generally I'll hear about the lore side of things, but I have no connection to the kit or graphics side of things.

I _do know_ that the team read the Boards (and Reddit, and other places) and will be going through all the feedback and questions.  Unfortunately, asking me is like asking the janitor why the patch isn't live yet.  I'm really sorry.

I am honestly really put off by the Lucius Malfow look

There's nothing in this that feels like swain. They completely removed the majority of his character elements; The limp, Cane, Beatrice, Morphing into a Demonbird, the hiding of the face, etc. The new kit in no way reflects Swain. There's no DoT, no zone control effects, no transformation on demand and mana management.  They created an entirely new champion with the thinnest veneer of Swain and tacked on the shitty edgelord anime look. 

Riot used to be so good with subtle changes to a kit or design that really improves on the character while keeping identity intact; Sejuani, Ashe, or Malphite being perfect examples. But lately if you like a character and kit older than 3-4 years better kiss it the fuck goodbye.  Rito doesn't like how your champ plays and is going to strip it down to a name, turn every ability into a skill shot, and tack on the edgelord...

I'm torn on being excited or not... His kit looks interesting, but... That's not swain, don't kid yourself. This should have been a kit on a whole new champion. Not only does the gameplay not feel like "swain", he doesn't even visually feel like Swain. They just removed Swain from the game and gave a new champion his name. So, I mean... I'm excited to try this new champion, but I want swain back...

This is exactly how I feel. While I'm fine with his kit being changed, there is no visual representation of the old Swain. His old design made him look like a mysterious, rugged and perhaps somewhat hard to look at person. Non of that comes back in his new design, and has been replaced for long edge-lord hair.
His abilities had a green color palette and mist-like aesthetics, which have now been replaced by red lightning.

And of course, where are the birds?

No cane, no limp, no eyepatch (outside of Northern Front), no Beatrice, no full bird demon form - this honestly doesn't feel anything like Swain anymore from a visual standpoint. It looks more like an upgrade for Blood Lord Vlad. Really disappointed. :(
